title: Friction - dependence on contact area for a block

content.question: A rectangular block is pushed by a constant force and accelerates along a rough horizontal surface. The block can be oriented to slide along any of three different sides, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>. Sides <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> have surface areas <math alttext="S sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="S sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="S sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="S sub A is less than S sub B, which is less than S sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>. On which side should the block be placed to have the greatest magnitude of acceleration?

choices.label: Any side, since the acceleration would be the same for all three sides

content.answer: Any side, since the acceleration would be the same for all three sides
